evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: Public speaking anxiety for research presentation, overcommitted schedule causing burnout, and roommate conflicts about quitting soccer/borrowing clothes. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: Practice presentations in empty lecture halls; drop soccer team; use positive communication scripts for roommate discussions. 3) Student's response: Immediately scheduled lecture hall practice, dropped soccer team freeing 3 evenings/week, and successfully implemented hoodie-borrowing boundary. 4) Evidence of progress: Concrete action plans set for public speaking practice, regained time for lab work/sleep, and demonstrated assertive communication with roommate.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Discussed: 1) Anxiety about research presentation in large lecture hall, 2) Overcommitment from intramural soccer causing sleep loss, 3) Roommate conflicts (quitting team, hoodie borrowing, dishes). Solutions: Practice presentations in empty halls, drop soccer team, use scripts for difficult conversations. Zachary accepted: Scheduled lecture hall practice, immediately quit soccer, practiced boundary-setting scripts. Progress: Freed 3 evenings/week, demonstrated firmer communication in roleplay, committed to practice session with specific plan.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Discussed public speaking anxiety for upcoming research presentation, overcommitted schedule causing burnout, and roommate conflicts about quitting soccer/borrowed items. Solutions included practicing in empty lecture halls, dropping soccer to free time, and scripted conversations with roleplay. Zachary accepted all: dropped soccer immediately, scheduled lecture hall practice, attended Toastmasters, and successfully roleplayed boundary-setting. Progress shown through freed schedule, committed practice plan, and confident boundary enforcement during roleplay.
